title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs. These programs provide full-time clinical nurse specialist education to registered nurses with the objective of producing qualified clinical nurse specialists. Nurse specialist programs supported under this act provide full-time clinical education to registered nurses. The objective is to educate clinical nurse specialists capable of providing care across the wellness and illness continuum to inpatients and outpatients. Additionally, nurse-managed health clinics, managed by advanced practice nurses, offer primary care or wellness services to underserved populations. The Health Service Act is amended to include a definition of a nurse-managed health clinic, which is managed by advanced practice nurses and provides primary care or wellness services to underserved populations. The National Advisory Council on Nurse Education and Practice is also updated to include clinical nurse specialists. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs includes amending various sections of the Public Health Service Act to update years from 2007 to 2021 and from 2014 to 2021 for loan repayment, scholarship programs, nurse faculty loan program, and comprehensive geriatric education. In section 871 of the Public Health Service Act, funding for parts B, C, and section 831 is updated to 2021. Section 831 is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel. The Public Health Service Act is updated to 2021, amending section 831 to promote career advancement for nursing personnel by providing training opportunities for various healthcare roles. The Public Health Service Act is updated to 2021, amending section 831 to promote career advancement for nursing personnel by providing training opportunities for various healthcare roles, including developing internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing. The Public Health Service Act is updated to 2021, amending section 831 to promote career advancement for nursing personnel by providing training opportunities for various healthcare roles, including developing internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing. This includes developing specialties and encouraging mentoring. Subsection (g) is also revised to include nurse-managed health clinics. Subsection (h) is removed.
